p: Balloon-like and hydropic degeneration in hepatocytes, nuclear pycnosis, vacuolar degeneration, congestion in sinusoids and accumulation of fatty vocals and steatosis were evaluated histopathologically and scored semiquantitatively. Diffuse balloon-like and hydropic degeneration in hepatocytes was found to be more severe ( p > 0.05) in the groups where 0.25% and 1.5% NO was used ( Figure 1B–E). Accumulation of diffuse fat vacuoles and severe fat in the liver were determined in the groups where the highest rate of NO was used ( Figure 1D,E), while it was found to be similar in the control group and the group in which low amounts of NO were used ( Figure 1A–C). Pycnosis in hepatocytes, and congestion in sinusoids and Kupffer cells were found in all experimental groups. In addition, no hyperplasia was found in the bile ducts.
